website_summaries.verdict: Thicker than others on the market, this mat works well for people who need help gliding their chairs over deeper pile carpet.
pros: Comes at 1/8" thickness with an extra-hard surface
A very strong mat that resists cracking or denting
cons: The mat is not completely transparent, but has a bit of a hue

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you buy the right one!
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully manufactured! NOTE(!) make sure the item you are buying says "Sold by DoubleCheck and fulfilled by Amazon". A few people have reported receiving the mat rolled up in a box, stamped Made In China and smells awful. This is NOT the product! The mat 1/8" thick Polycarbonate (same material as protective eye wear and bullet proof glass), has no smell, and clearly stated Made In Germany (see picture). The mat is so thick and sturdy that there is absolutely NO way that it can be rolled up. My chair rolls on it so smoothly. This one should last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Kingmeow

customer_reviews.title: This is the chair mat you want.
customer_reviews.text: This is the chair mat you want. I weigh 200 lbs and my desk chair is another 50 lbs and this mat holds up perfectly with no signs of denting or warping. I use it over the carpet in my house and the mat lays flat on top of it even when I am sitting in my chair. My desk chair moves smoothly across the surface of the mat while I am sitting in it. I have owned the mat for about a month now with several hours of use every day and there has been no change in its performance. The picture shows the absence of any dents or warps after 1 month of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: spoon4peace

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. Promised not to crack or break but within a month there is a growing crack. May actually do better on the floor rather than a rug. Very thick but didn't do what promised. I am adding to my review of the mat. Amazon was wonderful in response to my issue. I received a full refund. The mat continues to crack but i will keep it until I can find something to cover my carpet. Maybe a wood plank! They did request a picture of the mat which I am going to supply Great customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Trixie-Anne

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: Seemed sturdy when it arrived but it only lasted approximately 3 months from the time I put it down till it completely cracked. I do use it daily in my home office on medium ply carpet with a rolling office chair, however, I would expect at least a year or two for the price. The return window is only 30 days.... and now I know why.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Non Breakable, mine is cracked in several places...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was advertised as Non Breakable. It's not unbreakable, mine is cracked in several places and needs replacing. I'm very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Parl Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Not shipped flat as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Ad said it would be shipped flat! Was not, was rolled up tighter than a drum. Will be forever getting it to lay flat. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Beware.
customer_reviews.text: The prongs, for lack of a better word, on the bottom of the mat dig into the loops in our carpet and has pulled a few of them up. I had to take this mat up because it was ruining our carpet. I did not notice this until it was past the window to return or I would have returned it and got my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Santa

customer_reviews.title: Expiration date 4 months from purchase
customer_reviews.text: When I received the mat I thought it seemed pretty sturdy and figured other reviewers must have received a faulty mat or were really rough with it. I've had this for approximately 4 months and it is now cracking into a million pieces. I'm so disappointed. I work from home and use this 5 days a week. I really thought this was going to be a great solution. The search continues...
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: cracked after a month
customer_reviews.text: I like how thick the plastic is. It would make it better for thicker carpets. except that the pins do not hold it in place. Every day I had to fix its position because it would slip whenever I moved my office chair. It then cracked within a month or two of normal use. The "pop" sound it makes when I roll over the crack makes the mat not worth using.
customer_reviews.author: John Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Has a yellow-ish hue to it that shows up really bad on light colored carpet. Otherwise it's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Functionally, this thing is solid. Much thicker than my last chair mat. The downfall, however, is that this mat has a really ugly yellow-ish tint that is exacerbated by my carpet color. I wish that it wad made to be clear/transparent. See the pictures. The only warning I have is if you have a light-colored carpet, this will definitely darken the area where the mat is with a yellow-ish hue.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Seven months in and the "Unbreakable" mat is broken
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this chair mat. I must admit it arrived in great cshape and has been an ideal chair mat until about a month ago. With no difference in carpet, chair, or location, the mat has developed three large cracks, one completely to the edge producing a sharp edge. More frustating si my attempt to contact the seller or Amazon about a warrenty for this product. In fairness, Amazon said for warranty issues contact the seller, DoubleClick Products, but so far I have tried to communicate with them thru Amazon messaging but Amazon says my inquiry is invalid. What a black hole. I would love to hear from the seller about this.
customer_reviews.author: Pooofjolly

customer_reviews.title: Cracked within a week
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our desk and it cracked with in a week. It is only used 35-40 hours per week so not excessive use. I don't normally leave reviews but I was coming on to buy another desk mat and found it ironic when Amazon offered for me to buy this one again and the description caught my eye "non breakable".
customer_reviews.author: njvw

customer_reviews.title: Clear & Sturdy office chair desk mat
customer_reviews.text: Just redecorated two home offices and put down medium/low pile carpeting with an extra heavy pad underneath. These mats stay in place and are very clear, allowing the new carpet to show through nicely. A heavy, tall-back executive chair slides over it with ease. There's little "give" in the mat, so the chair doesn't get bogged down as it has with some vinyl mat. Very satisfied with purchase. Only complaint is that I wish they came in a very slightly larger size (maybe 2in. more in all directions). If they do, I couldn't find it on Amazon when I placed my order.
customer_reviews.author: pksimons

customer_reviews.title: Loved it - until it broke!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair mat 1.5 months ago and I loved it...until today. The mat sits on top a low-medium pile carpet (on the lower side). It has allowed my chair to move freely, and has not warped or developed indentations in it like other more pliable mats. Unfortunately, as I sat in my chair today, I heard a pop and found that the mat cracked under a wheel. I'm 5'10", average build, so the mat SHOULD be able to support me no problem. This is a 5-star product if you're a child. If you're an average size adult, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: moves around, not helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Thinking this was heavy duty, I thought it would stay on the floor in the same space. I find myself adjusting it multiple times a week so I can slide my chair as needed at my desk. The prong don't keep the mat in place. Would love to return this and get a refund!
customer_reviews.author: H. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Heave duty carpet saver mat
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality product, especially when compared with most of the cheap, Chinese made ones that are sold in stores. This one is sturdy and flexible and looks like it may last a long time. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Hollister

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps the Last Chair Mat I'll Ever Buy
customer_reviews.text: This product came in a flat box and ready to use. It is strong and perfect for my medium size office chair. I also appreciate the fact that it is clear so that my carpet shows through. You wouldn't know it's there if not for the reflections from overhead lights. The mat grabs the carpet and doesn't slide at all. It's so well made it may be the last chair I'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Eck

customer_reviews.title: Functional and aesthetic in home environment
customer_reviews.text: We needed a chair mat that would support a large person and not look too conspicuous at our corner computer desk. So far, this is acceptable but we've only had it a week so durability is unknown. It is a little wider than wanted so I elevated the desk slightly to keep corners from setting close to the edges. See photo. The mat is as described on Amazon. Thick with grippy points on the backside. It doesn't slip on our home carpet. The upper side is slightly textured for controlling chair roll and shoe traction. The matt is semitransparent so it shows the carpet beneath it and doesn't detract from the visual appearance of the room.
customer_reviews.author: Neotoma

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, it's hard!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sitting in a chair on this mat while I write this review. There is no bend. It's hard. It's functional. It's everything you want a mat to be! My chair slides on it like a wet baby seal. The best chair mat EVER!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Hard, flat, and smooth without indents from furniture
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic chair mat! Hard and smooth, and, unlike many others, it does not dent. It remains hard and smooth even under full sized office furniture. Whereas I was alway negotiating indentations in previous mats when I needed to roll the chair to a different location, that is no longer the case. Even after sitting still for longer periods of time, when I start to move the chair, it rolls smoothly, without getting caught in furniture indents. NOTE: The mat is still very new and only time will tell regarding durability, but at this time I am quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: RevBill60

customer_reviews.title: Asymmetrical and dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously most carpet protectors have spikes on the bottom to prevent the mat from sliding around on the carpet, but the one that I received was not cut properly; one side has larger dimensions than the other which means that the spikes are on the very edge where it should be safe to grab. Because of this, I got a pretty significant gash when I was setting it up - the front has the proper indentation so it can be safely grabbed from the outside but the bottom has spikes to the literal edge. This in addition to the fact that it is asymmetrical. If you do decide to buy, wear gloves when unpacking and setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: One word - "Non Breakable" is untrue - Avg man cracked badly in < year
customer_reviews.text: I'm an average man (6 ft / 225) with a standard low carpet sitting nice new office chairs with large casters. After less than 10 months, this "Non Breakable" pad started cracking. Every day the cracks get longer and louder as I use my office and slightly move left or right to grab a fax or something. This was supposed to be heavy duty and "Non Breakable" but it is neither. I am in the office maybe 20 hours a week over the last year and it has yellowed a bit already and also cracked badly. Very disappointed in this product and the fact that Amazon advertises it as a "favorite".
customer_reviews.author: Scott G

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: The problem with most of these mats is that after time they begin to crack where the chair's wheels go over them. So I really can't rate durability for some time. However this one seems to feel a bit sturdier than other ones I have had. The chair wheels glide over the surface very easily and the mat stays put on my carpet. Unlike most mats sold for mailing this one came flat in a large flat box. So there were no issues with straightening out a mat that was already stressed in shipping. This was perfectly flat right out of the box. I thought that was pretty impressive. So I* also rate the seller very highly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Price

customer_reviews.title: It has cracked!
customer_reviews.text: According to the description, this mat is made of"Polycarbonate" and is "stiff as metal and transparent like glass unbeatable durability long lasting won’t break crack scratch curl or discolor in normal use," Yes, it is stiff, but easy to move, is very transparent; however, i began to crack within the year. I do really like that it is delivered flat and has little odor "out of the box.". I may soon have to order a replacement. I understand that the mat has been improved to avoid cracking under normal use. I certainly hope so!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Thinner than 1⁄8"
customer_reviews.text: This is a thick enough mat but it is not 1⁄8" thick as advertised. Mine measures .105" thick which is .020" shy of 1⁄8". That's 16% thinner than advertised. Update after a few days of use. This pad slides around on our berber carpet which is definitely a low to medium pile. It seems the nibs on its bottom are not as long as our previous mat. Downgrading to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: GU

customer_reviews.title: Best Floor Mat I’ve Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. My last couple mats, which I have purchased at a large office box store, have never lasted. They start cracking and once that happens, they’re goners. And they never felt smooth rolling on the mat. This mat is everything those weren’t. Smooth feel during rolling, sturdy, completely non slipping, and the perfect size. I thought the price was great. And something I didn’t even think about when I ordered it: it ships flat. So, no more having to unroll it and waiting for it to flatten out (which I feel shortened the life of the other mats). Want a great chair mat for your office ... This is it,
customer_reviews.author: IndyMcGinley

customer_reviews.title: Easy, quick & simple!
customer_reviews.text: My old mat was trashed, so this one had to be better. I tend to replace these mats a lot because they have to span the edge of a rug over carpet, and I buy the thinner, less expensive ones. This mat was very reasonably priced and shipped flat, as described. It is the smoothest mat I've had in a long time - my chair rolls very easily. I've always bought my mats at an office supply store and struggled with them from the cart to the house. It's hard to overestimate the convenience of having it shipped to your door. Thanks, delivery person!
customer_reviews.author: Don Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended as this will crack on you.
customer_reviews.text: First I am a large man, I weigh in at 275lbs. (124.738kg). I have been looking for a solid mat for my computer room. This is not it. This mat started cracking on me about 8 to 10 months in, nothing major at first. The mat still is working but there are numerous cracks as you can see in the picture. If you are a large person looking for a solid product then I would recommend you pass on this mat.
customer_reviews.author: Kallan

customer_reviews.title: Solved my chair getting stuck! Sweet Freedom!
customer_reviews.text: So it is a mat. It is heavy duty. It came shipped flat and is like a hard plastic with teeth on the bottom. I bought it to put under my office chair that is on carpet. Before hand, my chair was always getting stuck. The mat does the job that I need it to do. Like all mats, this one does migrate some each day. So I have to reposition it every few days. But it's not a big deal. It is holding up to all the abuse I put it through. I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews and this is the one I settled on, and I am happy that I did.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer Chick

customer_reviews.title: At 13 months it started cracking....
customer_reviews.text: And now it is 14 months and it seems like every time I move you can hear it popping. The first 12 months were great, I just wish that the product could have lasted longer...
customer_reviews.author: MJS Marietta GA

customer_reviews.title: Great product.. so far.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased two different variations from a retail store (Office Max/Depot), had problems with both. In a nutshell this one here I have been very satisfied so far. I'm 6'6" and 250#s, the wheels of my office chair would sink or leave small divets in the so called "Heavy Duty" carpet mat. I couldn't find a strong enough one out in town so I researched here @ Amazon and am very happy at this point. This mat is everything it says. I'm an optimist however a realist, who's to say it wont crack in the future...I'll keep you posted. If this mat fails YOU WILL see an update here. 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Airkahuna

customer_reviews.title: Good rigid quality
customer_reviews.text: I just love this chair mat! I wanted a rectangular mat without a lip that would cover the area under and around my teen son's student desk, which sits on a medium pile carpet. The carpet was developing damage from the chair legs, and this mat goes under most of the desk lengthwise with enough to cover the area he sits with the chair legs, so it is unobtrusive in the space. It is very rigid, and high quality, and doesn't move around much at all because it has carpet grippers on the underside. I'm confident this will prove to last and will save our carpeting from any damage, while being an attractive option too...all we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Macleod

customer_reviews.title: My non breakable mat broke in 7 days
customer_reviews.text: I received this mat exactly a week ago. It had all the promise of being unbreakable. It came in a flat package because it doesn't curl up. It felt thick and solid. No more chopping up my feet like the cheap mat I had before when it developed several cracks (I work from home with bare feet). Maneuvering my office chair on it was terrific. I was very satisfied. Then today I heard a loud crack. Lo and behold, the non-breakable mat broke. I already recycled the flat package it came in, so I don't think there's any way to return it for a replacement, and it's possible the second one would break, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!! NO DENTING, STAYS PUT, Easy to slide on, Arrives in FLAT Box! No smell. WORTH THE MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: VERY heavy duty, NO DENTING, STAYS PUT on carpet, Easy to slide on it, Arrives in FLAT Box! No flattening process. AND No smell! WORTH THE MONEY. I bought a different half the cost one first online (that i quickly returned!!) that said heavy duty...but within a half hour of sitting on it with a office chair it had dented and i couldn't barely slide my chair without a lot of effort. it also smelled terrible, Had to 'flatten it' for days and it still wasn't flat. You get what you pay for. this one will last years I can already tell. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: Surprised I feel compelled to write a review for a chair mat, but I am so far very impressed. It’s much thicker and more firm than any I’ve ever had before. I’m 6’ 250lbs and the wheels don’t dent it at all. Roll is smooth, almost too smooth as sometimes I roll off. That brings me to the next point. When i do go off the edge, I can easily roll back on thanks to the thickness and firmness on the edge. It doesn’t roll up or feel like it’s going to break at all. Only had this for a few days so time will tell on longevity but so far I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thick! HEAVY!
customer_reviews.text: You wouldn't believe what this mat weighs. It was a struggle getting it up the stairs. That's a good point, though, because once in place it STAYS in place, and by design it won't roll up along the edges. On unwrapping, the mat didn't smell, as these products tend to do. Although the nubs/grippers on the bottom are quite sharp -- you should take care handling with bare hands -- the rug beneath shows no sign of damage. Also, about five months in use, the mat shows no sign of going brittle, cracking or yellowing.
customer_reviews.author: That Adorable Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Works Great...Nevermind!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Welp it didn't last too long. Lasted about a year before the first crack and it only got worse from there. Now it cracks a lot more often and is getting to the point where I'll have to throw it out. Keep in mind it is not like I used it everyday for a year. I'd say it would only last about 3-4 months of daily use. ( I don't use my desktop too often) Original: So far so good. It is made of thick poly-carbonate and grips to the carpet very well. I haven't had any problems with the mat cracking or forming any blemishes. Very good mat!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair mat because the description says " the corners stay flat, has a lip, studded underside holds the mat firmly in-place, and good for medium pile carpet" All of these claims are not the case with the product I received. I have to re position the mat 3-4 times daily, the corners have caused several stubbed toes, and the chair falls off the mat constantly and that is annoying. The second star is just because it hasn't broken in the 40 days I've owned it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Perez

customer_reviews.title: defective and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I have had three of these from this company, and the latest is clearly not the same. The thickness and firmness are now flimsy, and the product does NOT lie flat against a lower-pile carpet. In fact, the day I put this down, the edge was curled enough not to notice but to catch my foot, trip me, and lacerate the top of my toes (ugly-foot pic included). I would like to say that this is not only defective but a hazard to anyone who might come in contact with it. Never again from this company.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Started cracking after 21 months, but that's pretty good under heavy daily use
customer_reviews.text: Just noticed the other day that my floor mat started cracking. I decided to look up my order because I couldn't remember how long I've had it. Turns out I bought in January 2019. I work from home so I am in the chair at least 8 hours day. I think the mat has served me well. I've never had it slip around on the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME IMPROVEMENT OVER LAST ONE I BOUGHT
customer_reviews.text: Last one bought was cheap bluish soft plastic (polyethylene?) that warped horribly in use. It actually a pulled wheel off my chair when trying to get back over edge. This one arrived next day in flat package - Is virtually clear, hard and flat. My chair even rolls 50% easier than on it. Stays perfectly in place. BUT NOTE - having read another review, did notice that the edges are relatively sharp - that reviewer said he cut his foot on it. Took mine right to the garage and worked the edges with a file to break the sharp edges. With that precaution behind me - LOVE It and highly recommend purchase
customer_reviews.author: careful buyer

customer_reviews.title: Works well on short pile carpet.
customer_reviews.text: I have this chair mat at home and at work. Very happy with it for the most part. My only issue is the size. It's the size it advertises, so no issue there. It's just smaller than both the mats I had before, so I've had to get used to having less roll space. Not a huge thing, but it's a bit distracting when I'm not paying attention and it catches the wheels of the chairs when I go off the edge. But it's durable, hard, stays in place and seems to hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stratton

customer_reviews.title: update:  this mat is not non-breakable!  here is my thoughts after light usage for over a year
customer_reviews.text: Just received product, very nice quality. However, dinging a star because it was NOT shipped flat. Be careful releasing the shipping strap, the mat is under high pressure against the straps. Update: 2/5/2019 I know this is over a year from my first review but, this mat has not turned out to be very durable. Under what I would consider to be light usage, it has big chunks coming out of it and I will have to soon toss it in the trash. Amazon issued a partial refund due to misleading advertising (non-breakable). I would not recommend this item to anyone, it just doesn't hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: wildusa

customer_reviews.title: Cracked within the year!
customer_reviews.text: This has been used light duty in son's room. Now it's clearly cracked through in several spots where the wheels roll over it. Disappointed, it was not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Quintessence

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but watch out for the edge
customer_reviews.text: The mat certainly looks more durable than the one it replaces -- and that's a very good thing. It's kind of thick, and I guess I was expecting a tapered edge rather than an abrupt change in height from carpet to mat. I tend to work barefoot and have stubbed a toe twice on the edge. With practice, I hope that won't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Randall D. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Roughly 8 months into use and just had it's first crack.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this roughly 8 months ago and already has first crack. Prior to that it seemed to have been holding up well enough. Not sure another manufacturer will make the difference, the design at this price point is pretty much the same. I'll just be careful and continue to use for now. Edit: 13 months after purchase and crack has spread fully to the edge. Won't be able to continue to use. I'm sure the crack will continue to spread much more quickly now and is a hazard to small children's toes.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Moves More Than Desk Chair
customer_reviews.text: This mat travels across my carpet quicker than my desk chair does. These little nubs on the underside don’t dig into the carpet, even if it is low or medium pile, at all and this of course lets the pad travel both sideways and back and forth. I need to reposition this pad each and every time I move the desk chair when using it. It seems to be both thick and durable but sliding around on the carpet all the time makes it less than desirable. Lot of money to pay for something that must be repositioned after every use.
customer_reviews.author: N8860

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a skinny guy to say the least, and the less expensive mats seemed to not have great durability. I haven't had this one that long, but so far it's protected my living room carpet well. If this lasts it will be worth the higher cost. I have a fairly low carpet, and have had no problems with the mat shifting or curling. It stands up just a little bit at the edge; 1/16" inch or less. Doesn't bother me. Waiting to see how long it will last. So far it looks good. I'll update ig necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Casey T.

customer_reviews.title: Cracked in 11 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June of last year. 11 months later as I'm rolling on it I hear a loud crack. Sure enough, right under one of the wheels. The crack has grown over the past couple days so I'm once again shopping for the elusive high-quality chair mat. When I originally bought this one I loved it. Flat. Hard. Rolled nicely. Barely flexed at all when I moved on it. I work from my home office 40 hours a week, sometimes more, so I did use the heck out of it. I am also not light (270 pounds), just to give you an idea of use. I just hoped it would last more than 11 months.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sommer

customer_reviews.title: Very thick and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: You need to buy this if you have carpet and don't want your chair to sink. I tried 2 others before this both claiming to be thick and they weren't. The material is very thick on this one and allows your chair to roll smoothly and it doesn't sink into the carpet and the wheels don't make indentions. It doesn't slide around like other chair mats and stays in place. Spend the money and buy this one. It is also shipped flat so there's no unrolling and there is no odor. You'll be disappointed if you buy the cheaper ones. This one is the best!
customer_reviews.author: groovygal

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for thicker carpet
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this one to replace another that I had only a few months. I have med pile carpet and decided to spend a bit more money for something a bit more sturdy, and it was well worth it. I read the reviews about it shifting, but I have mine up against the wall on one edge, so it hasn't moved at all for me. I'm 240 lb. and spend 10-12 hours on it 3-4 days a week, and so far this thing is showing no signs of wear (which the previous one did by now). I waited a while before writing the review, and so far this mat is WAY better than others I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Comes Packed Flat
customer_reviews.text: Do not have to unroll it since it comes shipped flat. No indents at all with my 200+ pounds on it. Rolls very smoothly. Highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Greg L

customer_reviews.title: Buy This One
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed for under the dining room table where we run our business.....Very thick and clear and large enough that it will protect carpet and let us slide chairs and not have chair legs dig into carpet......or have feet under and making carpet dirty with oils from feet.....we are clean but barefoot still makes carpet dirty with the natural oils in skin.. We purchased 2 and couldnt be happier with them.....I really like the thickness of them.....not flimsy shipped flat in a large box that fit them.....no springing surprises just a nicely made item for plastic lol.
customer_reviews.author: Tiare Dream

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at Its Toughness
customer_reviews.text: This matt seems extremely tough. I'm very pleasantly surprised. I probably roll 300 lbs. around on this thing, if not more (when you include the chair), and it isn't showing any signs of stress or cracking. Even when rolling off the edge with round (cross section) rollerblade style wheels. It's comparatively expensive, but you won't be replacing it soon, if ever. UPDATE: I'm taking away a star :( and hope to put it back with good warranty support. My chair mat cracked under normal use on commercial carpet with no padding. It's been in almost daily use for 1.2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Threatt

customer_reviews.title: 4 months and it has already cracked
customer_reviews.text: Cracked after 4 months of workday use, despite the carpet being low pile. Every few days I have to readjust its position since it tends to wander around. It says it's for "Low and Medium Pile" but since it wanders and broke so quickly on a low pile carpet, I would suggest it would only be suitable for the extremely low pile, really hard carpeting you find in most office buildings. Of course, if you have that type of carpet you really don't need this chair mat anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Justin P

customer_reviews.title: Slips and cracks
customer_reviews.text: At first I really liked this chair mat. It was a step up from the mat I used to have. I did slip a bit and at least once every week I would have to re-center it, but that was no big deal. Then about six months ago it started cracking and now it's really badly cracked. My feet (and socks) and the wheels of my chair keep catching on the cracks. Guess it isn't so "heavy duty" after all. Time to find a new one!
customer_reviews.author: D. Conner

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as described
customer_reviews.text: It is not as sturdy as they claimed. Also, perhaps when it was in storage at the seller or Amzn, it was left leaning against a wall or something so it has a slight curve to it, which should go away once flat on the floor, but it was definitely deformed when I got it. The packing is not good quality, basically thin card board on each side.
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: It walks on the carpet.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good quality product, but like most desk chair mats with rug gripping spines on the bottom, it walks on the carpet, and has to be repositioned daily. The only solution I have found is to add carpet tape to the bottom edges, but that takes away from the transparency of the mat.
customer_reviews.author: R onH

customer_reviews.title: What I thought I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This chair mat seems to be well made and it's certainly easy to roll around on it if you have wheels on your desk chair. But the maneuverability is the problem for me. I have to roll at least one wheel off the mat lest the chair roll out from under me when I'm standing up or sitting down. So I have wheel marks in the carpet all around the mat, which defeats the purpose of having a mat. However, I would highly recommend it for people without wheels on their chairs.
customer_reviews.author: CDamon

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected and shipped flat as they said.
customer_reviews.text: This ships and flat and thus not issues unrolling. I am using it on what might be 1/2 inch crash thick carpet from an era long past. It stays mostly in place but unless it had extremely long studs that would not work for "Normal" carpet this is what I expected. So yes it drifts but it could be my silly kid and not so much that I am not purchasing another one for my wife. I use it with a Herman Miller Aeron chair with the standard wheels and it works great. I move easily but not too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Toby J. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: This is my 3rd purchase
customer_reviews.text: I liked this mat so much for my office chairs (which sit on a medium pile carpet) that I bought a third one for my sewing room chair.... and it is so much better than what I had in there. Working from home now, we are in our chairs on these mats daily for 8-11 hours/day and we are NOT petite people so these have been an excellent choice. They work great for medium pile carpet. I bought my first mat about 3 years ago-maybe- and it looks brand new. If I need a fourth mat in my house, this will be the one I get.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Wright-Gonos

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend it, considering the minimal usage and time frame ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this mat in Oct. 2017 and it had a thin hair line crack down the center. I was going to return it at that time, but since the crack thin and was only on the back side, we decided to keep it and see if it would be ok. It's been less than 6 mos. and already a big crack has formed and it is no longer returnable. I thought I read this mat has a lifetime warranty. I really had hoped we finally found a durable mat, I wouldn't recommend it, considering the minimal usage and time frame it held up. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Moore

customer_reviews.title: Lousy delivery
customer_reviews.text: I cannot speak to the durability of this chair mat yet as I have had it less than a week. I was pleased that it was delivered by UPS all in one piece and with no damage to the product itself even though the cardboard packaging was almost non-existant when it got here. With a fairly light-weight person and chair, the mat is great for rolling around and the mat seems to not move on the carpet. What more can I say about it? I will update this review if I see dents or cracking.
customer_reviews.author: KC in USA

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Mar 6, 2020 I've had this chair mat for just a couple of weeks, but it's working great for me so far. There hasn't been any scratching or cracking and nicely arrived flat. The only thing I would change about it so far is giving it a beveled edge. I walked toward this mat with bare feet and managed to hit my big toe against the edge and thought hmm, maybe a beveled edge would've been a little less painful. Now if I'm bare foot I stay aware of where the edge is and pick my feet up a litlle higher. Other than that I like this mat.
customer_reviews.author: R. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Ease of chair movement
customer_reviews.text: I rated this product recently. Do you just ignore what people write. Does the left hand not know what the right hand has accomplished. It is very irritating to be asked several times to comment. First of all you don't give the customer any time with the product before you want a review. As far as I can tell it is a good product, but I just recently started using it.
customer_reviews.author: barbara

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best chair mat I have ever purchased. When I get up, there are no dimples in the mat from my weight combined with the weight of the chair. My chair rolls very easily on this mat. In the past, I have purchased plastic chair mats and then covered them with a bamboo mat to try to counteract the sinking into the carpet, but that is not an issue with this mat. The carpet in my office is a pretty high pile carpet as well. My only complaint is that I wish they made them in a bigger size, but I will just purchase an additional mat to extend my rolling space.
customer_reviews.author: Bittersweet513

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a  little while...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good product--clear & sturdy looking. Im a small woman & I used it atop med pile carpeting but after 6 months of occasional home use it has a 4 inch long crack at one edge & if my chair slides near it it makes a cracking sound! Odd as the product title starts with NONBREAKABLE??? Our 3 yr old mat from Costco is still going strong with a big man using it. Dang I hate to shell out $55 bucks for another one.
customer_reviews.author: Sandeeez

customer_reviews.title: Works really well and stays in place!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been using this for a few months now in her at-home office. It stays put really well and she really likes the how easily she can roll her chair back and move around. Great product and it is standing up pretty well, also!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Mulkey

customer_reviews.title: So Far, It's Great
customer_reviews.text: I love that this shipped flat and I didn't have to deal with trying to get it to unroll and sit flat. It's fairly narrow, but that works well for my workspace. If I had a larger desk or workspace, I might not like that. I also like the tongue to sit beneath my desk so that when I roll forward I don't roll off the mat. My carpet is medium thick, and my chair rolls smoothly on the mat without any divets created.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Best chair mat for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best chair mat for the money. Don't go to any of those office supply shops and get a thinner, rolled up mat that you will have to flatten out, only for it to crack months later. This mat is sent flat and is REALLY sturdy. I've had it for a couple of months now and it still looks brand new. If you are looking for a chair mat for a carpet, search ends here. This is the one you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Not as thick and solid as made out to be
customer_reviews.text: My carpet is not that thick and I bought the sturdiest kind described. The chair rolls but not as easy as it should. It sinks into the mat a little which causes some resistance in moving. Also the bottom teeth don’t dig into the carpet well so the mat bends up on the corners a bit. I see an accident coming with my son’s toes soon. But his chair rolls for now. I’m thinking I’ll have to buy a glass mat instead
customer_reviews.author: L Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Better than others
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my parents who are using office chairs on the carpet. It was really hard for them to move around easily while working at their desks. I had purchased another brand earlier this year from Amazon but when it came in it was rolled up in boxes. I had read previous reviews but I thought I would take a change. Mistake. It was soft and sank where the wheels were making it hard to move. When this mat was delivered it was in a large flat box. Parents said they like it since it was thick and now it make it easy to move around and protect the carpet. So far so good!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Thick, stiff, doesn't slid around, and ships flat
customer_reviews.text: It seems like it is made well and comes adequately packaged. The only thing I worry about is possible future cracking. It is stiff and I wouldn't try to bend it a whole lot. I would say I have medium pile/average carpet as well, so time will have to tell with this product. As for now, it doesn't smell, it doesn't sink into the carpet, it ships flat and stiff, my chair rolls well on it, and I can save my new carpet from excessive wear. Pretty good for an Amazon $30 chair mat.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: CREEPS ON MEne DIUM CARPETS
customer_reviews.text: Constantly creeping on medium pile carpet. I don't think the spikes on bottom are long enough to grab and anchor the mat when I roll my 200lb frame on it in a 5 legged desk chair. Must reposition after each use.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm2

customer_reviews.title: Awful product couldn't last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mat for the excellent reviews and must say I'm terribly disappointed. My home office has carpet and I have a nice leather, 5 wheel executive chair. First issue I noticed is the mat won't stay in place due to sliding. Every couple of days I have to pull the chair off and readjust to keep it from hitting the desk. Worst of all, cracks have formed all over the mat to the point it is unusable now. It could not hold up to the movement with carpet underneath. If you have a hard floor it will probably be fine but don't waste your time if you have carpet. Total waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Gribnau

customer_reviews.title: Works even with a fairly thick rug, and I weight over 235!
customer_reviews.text: I have a fairly thick carpet, but this seemed the best option. When I first laid it down, and placed a chair on it and sat on it, I noticed in the reflection that the surface did sag slightly around the chair wheel. I thought “Oh No!’ However, the chair had no problem rolling around. I finally figured out that the sag was over a large area - maybe 8 inches across - but it was not at the wheel nor did it leave any indentations. So, in spite of the fact that I have a fairly thick rug, it still works great!
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I am keeping it because I threw the packing material away and can't ship it back but neither can I recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: This mat is rather small, something I didn't realize when I ordered it. If you are accustomed to a larger mat, this one will not get the job done. The other problem is that it doesn't stay in place. Any movement of your chair tends to make the mat slip over the carpeting. I think this is because the spikes are very poorly designed and insufficient to the task. I am keeping it because I threw the packing material away so shipping it back would be more trouble than it's worth but this mat is one of those items where the positive reviews get it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy mats that don't buckle with a heavy weight object
customer_reviews.text: My purpose for buying 2 of these rectangular chair mats was to place a very large organizational cabinet (it's called the "Dreambox" made by The Original Scrapbox) on top of it. This piece of furniture is a few hundred pounds and I haven't even filled it yet. Since it is on wheels, it needed to be on a smooth surface -- since the room I have it in is carpeted, this was the best option for me. So far, the mats are holding up great!
customer_reviews.author: DirtyDi

customer_reviews.title: invincible
customer_reviews.text: cheap and totally invincible. seriously 2yrs under a typical rolling desk chair, wielded by a 165lb 16ish yo hasnt killed it. has totally exceded my wildest expectations. not even a scratch, hasnt moved. this is really the ultimate in cheapest protect your carpet while your kid plays super gore video games and eats constantly technology. i would buy another butwhat would i use it for. lining the fing spacestation. nuclear defense system?
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: so glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: Our carpet at work is really old and has wrinkles in it that caused the chair to not roll around. This made my legs hurt really bad trying to force the chair to move. I bought this mat and it works so much nicer. It is very heavy duty and not really flexible. Do not drop it on your toes. It is very very hard and heavy. It does exactly what we wanted it to do though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT A HEAVY DUTY CHAIR MAT
customer_reviews.text: This was described as a mat to work on medium pile carpet. I have medium pile carpet. It does not stay in place, and it "gives" when I sit in the chair. I would not buy this mat if you have carpet other than thin berber or industrial grade carpeting. I will live with it for a while, then probably pitch it and find something that is truly heavy duty and that will stay in place when I roll my chair across it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Mat
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy product. Looks like it will hold up well long-term. I sit on this mat in my office chair from more than eight hours a day/40 hours a week. I am very overweight and it shows no sign of bending, warping or cracking. Excellent quality. Updating this review: I still think the mat is fantastic, but it does have one crack in it now, so it is certainly not indestructible. I am a very large person though, and I think a “normal“ wait person would not have any issue with warping or cracking. good product.
customer_reviews.author: Noel W. Fendlason

customer_reviews.title: Prongs are short
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy, strong mat but if you re going to put it on carpeting, be advised that it will "crawl." I have to adjust it every day before sitting down. My husband has to adjust his also. Probably should be on a floor covering that isn't so deep. That being said, the mat is easy to clean and very sturdy. No cracking, bending, or impressions from chairs.
customer_reviews.author: RestlessTime

customer_reviews.title: Having trouble seeing where the mat begins and the mat ends? Exactly!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the looks of this carpet, but I noticed that sitting on it directly was beginning to damage it. So I started looking hoping to find something super clear, super heavy, and just the right size. BINGO!! I really can't speak to durability because I've only had this thing a week. But they force you to rate in terms of durability so I just give it a five though I really have no idea. It is more expensive than other mats on the market but I'm hoping it will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Randy_H

customer_reviews.title: Better Than My Last One
customer_reviews.text: We moved from a house with hardwood floors to one with thick, padded carpet. The floor protector that I used in the old house was pretty useless on the mushy flooring, but this one is much better. It does give as I back away from my drafting table, sometimes causing me to roll farther than I wanted to, but this carpet is pretty thick and soft. It would be fine for commercial grade or a little higher pile.
customer_reviews.author: MTSOfan

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This product was just what I needed to set up an office in our spare room. It stays put on the berber carpet. It is sturdy enough to allow the office chair to roll around. I've had it a week, so I can't say how long it will hold up, but it seems durable. One thing I really like is that the edges are beveled so when you roll off the pad it is easy to roll back on.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Does not sink into carpet.  Apparently prone to cracking over time.
customer_reviews.text: Tried a chair mat from a local store of a national office supply outlet. Chair sank into carpet and was hard to roll. Returned to store in 2 days. After 12 weeks of heavy, daily use (user weighs roughly 200 lbs.) has shown this mat to be a keeper. This one cost a little more than the local store's, but it's well worth the difference. UPDATED 5/28/19 - Mat was received Dec 2018, developed a crack in about 3 months. Seller replaced mat, asking only for a picture of crack. Received replacement mat, which also cracked after 3 months. Both mats worked great until they cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Not really a Hoosier

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical it would not bend, but it does not
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old vinyl chair mat over a medium pile carpet. I have a wheeled office chair on top of it. My old mat had huge depressions where the wheels tended to go, and then cracked in two places. I've had this mat for a few months now, and there are no depressions! I weigh 220 pounds, so it gets a good workout. Chair moves smoothly. It's really nice when something actually works exactly the way it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Komuves

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff and it moves around
customer_reviews.text: They first shipped the wrong product so I had to waste my time dropping off the wrong item to UPS. But besides that, it's not what I'm used to buying from office depot. It's very hard like plastic so it seems like it'll be easily cracked if used by heavier/bigger person. Also, it doesn't stay put because the spikes are very short so it doesn't grip on to the carpet. It easily slides around on the carpet. Just spend the extra 20$ and buy the one they sell at office depot.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: I needed one for my rolling chaie to move on my rug which is medium to a little thick. The plastic moves all the time and I constantly have to readjust it. For the cost I didn't return it and do not get for hard floors because the "spikes" made to keep in place are sharp and will scratch the hard floor. They are just not long enough to keep it in place on a rug.
customer_reviews.author: Wappan

customer_reviews.title: But this product seems very good so far
customer_reviews.text: After 10 or so days of use, the mat appears to be holding up well. Way thicker material than I expected, and cheaper than comparable products at an office store. The holding spikes are rather short, so the mat can move a little bit on my mid-length carpet. Very close to a 5 star rating. I just have a hard time paying over $35 for a piece of plastic that my chair sits on. But this product seems very good so far.
customer_reviews.author: B633

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprise, when I got this as to how strong it really looked. I am a large woman and it actually hold up really well. I see no indentation from my weight or any scratches. I have only had it a little over a month but so far I am very impressed with it. I am sure it will hold up for a lot longer than my other one did that cracked in about 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT CHAIR MAT
customer_reviews.text: This chair mat is all it was advertised to be. It arrived on time in good condition in flat, sturdy packaging, ready for immediate use. It is clear, easily maneuvered, hardly noticeable, and stays in place. So far (arrived 2 weeks ago) it has been sturdy and durable. I would definitely recommend this chair mat.
customer_reviews.author: DMP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair mat!  Best ever!  Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I bough this to protect a nice rug in my office and have been using it for a few weeks. During that time I've seen it used by women and men up to 220lbs. No issues as all and it doesn't bend or cave under the chair wheels. It's a nice clear plastic and has very small spikes underneath to prevent it from sliding. The plastic is solid and firm and just feels like great quality. I like that it ships flat as it would be nearly impossible to bend this thing into a small circle. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Floor Mat will not hold up over six months!
customer_reviews.text: This Plastic Floor Mat only lasted six months before is was cracking and started to develops holes. I have plastic mats for use at my computers in several locations in my home, but this one is the worst. Most mats are expected to last 3 - 5 years, but not this one! For the high price paid on AMAZON, you are better off with the ones sold by COSTCO for $30. You would expect that one to be short lived, but theirs lasts several years. Good luck. Hope you have better results.
customer_reviews.author: Jack A

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't sure the thickness of this mat would be adequate but decided to take a chance and am very glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved my home office into a room with hardwood floors so I needed protection from the desk chair roller feet. I wasn't sure the thickness of this mat would be adequate but decided to take a chance and am very glad I did. It is perfect for my needs... thick enough for protection but thin enough not to be a tripping hazard. I liked it so much, I ordered another for under the piano bench in the same room. It's shipped flat (not rolled) so setup is fast. I'm VERY satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mat a year ago, and it is still in excellent shape! No cracks and perfect for carpet! I was so pleased, I recently ordered a 2nd one! And it's perfect! It was delivered FLAT, not rolled up like others. YES! I would definitely order this mat again, and like they say you get what you pay for! It's more expensive but well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Rosalind C. Norenberg

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: At my last house my carpet was destroyed from my chair sitting on it, so when we moved I knew I needed a good, sturdy mat to protect my carpet from my office chair. So far, this seems to do the job! I have had it for a couple of weeks now and it is very sturdy, does not leave any dents or imprints, and has not cracked or been damaged in any way. My chair rolls smoothly and I can feel confident knowing my carpet is safe. I am very pleased with this purchase and would highly recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: photomom17

customer_reviews.title: Lots to chose from, I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I read so many reviews and researched so many. This seems flimsy and it does have some give. But I am 220 lbs and this is holding up really well. It does not move at I’ll on my carpet and my chair has left absolutely zero marks or dents in it. Looks factory fresh. I am very happy with this product and after reading so many reviews I “took a chance”. Very very happy with this one
customer_reviews.author: Don S.

customer_reviews.title: Great chair mat
customer_reviews.text: This should last a long time. I can move it around easily on the carpet without getting poked with the studs that are on so many of the chair mats. I can tell the material is not brittle like most which is good because I roll around on it all day! It was shipped flat and not rolled which is great, however, it could have used a little reinforcement on the box as it had moved around during shipping and one end of the box was torn open. Otherwise, I'm happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne F

product_meta.title: Heavy Duty Carpet Chair Mat Polycarbonate Crystal Clear Thick and Sturdy For Low and Medium Pile Carpets 36 X 48 X 1/8 With Lip Shipped Flat 2nd Generation New and Improved
feature_bullets: “NEW” – After a lot of research and testing we have updated our “NEW” Chair Mats with “NEW” Polycarbonate stiff as metal and transparent like glass unbeatable durability long lasting won’t break crack scratch curl or discolor in normal use, CLEANING INSTRUCTIONS= Only clean with chemical free water, chemicals can cause the mat to weaken and crack

HEAVY DUTY - Thickest chair mat available in the market measures at 1/8 of an inch in approx. sturdy and firm surface office chair mat to insure wheels don't sink or leave indentations and that the corners stay flat.
HIGHLY TRANSPARENT - Allowing the beauty of your floor to shine through.

SUPER GRIP BACKING - Studded underside holds the mat firmly in place designed for use on low and medium pile carpets the lip extends beyond the main rectangular area of the mat to protect the floor under the desk THIS IS NOT INTENDED FOR HARDWOOD FOR OUR HIGH QUALITY HARDWOOD MATS PLEASE SEARCH B072TPG1VS
ENVIRONMENTAL - Phthalate free and free from volatile toxic compounds to keep a healthy indoor environment.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,988 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
